document_data.power2e: [[Intermediate deity]]<ref group="note">While [[Cult of the Dragon (sourcebook)|''Cult of the Dragon'' (1998)]] lists him as an intermediate deity, [[Draconomicon (1990)|''Draconomicon'' (1990)]] states that he is a greater deity.
document_data.symbol2e: A black circle superimposed on a larger, concentric white circle
document_data.mainbody: '''Zorquan''' ({{Pronounce|ZORE|kwon|refs=}}) was the [[neutral]] [[draconic pantheon|dragon god]] of [[dragon]]kind and "dragonness", that is, the essence of what it was to be a dragon. Zorquan was supposed to encompass all alignments dragonkind could have, but was often regarded as neutral.
document_data.Description: Myths held that Zorquan could take the form of a perfect specimen of whatever species of dragonkind he wished to. His eyes crackled with sparks, sometimes spitting lightning bolts that flashed and cracked around his body.
document_data.Realm: Some believed Zorquan had a castle in the [[Prime Material Plane]]. Legends told of dragons with the temerity to visit his halls, but gave no details on how to get there. More recent accounts told of Zorquan residing on the neutral plane of the [[Outlands]].
document_data.History: It was widely believed that it was Zorquan who influenced the dragon's apathy toward their gods during the [[Time of Dragons]], as a way to stop the wars between the different religious factions of dragons, as those wars threatened to extinguish the whole dragon population of [[Toril]].
document_data.Worshipers: Members of all species of dragonkind worshiped Zorquan.
document_data.Dogma:
Although Zorquan was often said to be the deity of dragonkind, his true role was as the deity of "dragonness", the central ideals of what dragons believed was the concept of being a dragon: power, pride—which all dragons, even [[Gold dragon|golds]], had in abundance—and most importantly, status.

Zorquan was totally unconcerned with creatures of non-draconic species, unless their behavior affected dragonkind in any way. He was said to be the implacable enemy of any who would harm dragonkind as a race. However, he didn't care about individuals. As such, he didn't bother to punish adventurers for killing the occasional [[chromatic dragon]].
